title: Augusta: Joseph N. Ryan to George E. McEndree, December 7, 1887
summary: Ryan discusses the battles of their company and regiment, also sending along a copy of their old company's muster roll, noting that the previous holder had been wounded leaving a large "splotch" of blood on McEndree's name. Referring to the war, he expresses the belief that "we were not whipped but 'wore ourselves out whipping the other side'."
keywords: Battle Description, Death/Casualties, Enlistment, Patriotism, Prisons/Prisoners, State Government, American Civil War
